skill.name: openapi-generator
skill.description: Generate comprehensive OpenAPI/Swagger specifications from existing code and APIs.
skill.summary: Generate comprehensive OpenAPI/Swagger specifications from existing code and APIs.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and instructions. No executable code, no network access, no file system access, no external commands. Risk-free.

content.value_statement: Creating API documentation manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill generates comprehensive OpenAPI 3.0+ specifications from code and APIs automatically.
actual_capabilities: Generate OpenAPI 3.0+ specifications from existing API code
Extract endpoints, methods, parameters, and request/response schemas
Add authentication schemes and security definitions
Validate OpenAPI compliance and schema consistency
Support multiple frameworks including Express.js, FastAPI, and Go
limitations: Does not execute code - generates specifications based on provided information
Cannot access local files without explicit user input
Requires user to provide API details or source code for generation

use_cases.title: Document REST APIs
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive OpenAPI specs from Express.js, FastAPI, or Go code.

use_cases.title: Create API Reference Guides
use_cases.description: Produce standardized API documentation with examples and authentication details.

use_cases.title: Validate API Contracts
use_cases.description: Ensure OpenAPI specifications are compliant and consistent across services.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an OpenAPI 3.0 specification for my REST API. Here is my Express.js route code:

prompt_templates.title: From Description
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an OpenAPI 3.0 specification for a user management API with CRUD operations.

prompt_templates.title: Add Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate this OpenAPI specification and suggest improvements for compliance:

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate OpenAPI documentation for my FastAPI endpoints with Pydantic models.

best_practices: Provide complete endpoint code or detailed descriptions for accurate specification generation
Include authentication requirements and security schemes in your request
Specify response status codes and error schemas for comprehensive documentation
anti_patterns: Asking the skill to execute code or make network requests
Expecting automatic file system access without explicit paths
Requesting the skill to deploy or modify running services

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Express.js, FastAPI, Go, and any language where you can provide endpoint details.

faq.question: What OpenAPI versions can it generate?
Can it integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Output is compatible with Swagger UI, Stoplight Studio, Postman, and ReadMe.

faq.question: Is my code sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that processes code locally within your AI session.

faq.question: Why is my specification failing validation?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing required fields, invalid schema references, or incorrect data types.

faq.question: How does this differ from openapi-generator-cli?
faq.answer: This skill generates specifications using AI; the CLI tool generates client SDKs from existing specs.
